review_title: Professional firm with some of the most well respected recruiters in the industry
years_at_company: Professional firm with some of the most well respected recruiters in the industry
pros:
-Constant training for new recruiters with our senior mentors
-Uncapped earnings potential
-Tremendous opportunity to be exposed to all levels of the organization
-Management truly cares about the growth and development of their team
-Lots of team focused events like team sponsored happy hours, holiday celebrations, summer Fridays, Atlantic Group softball team, and company sponsored group workouts.
cons: -If you want a typical 9-5 job where you stare in front of a computer screen all day, this is not the place for you.
advice_to_mgmt: -The more we grow the better we get. Our current team is the best we have ever had. If anyone has something negative to say about the organization it is because they are just not cut out for this business.

pros:
The culture - awesome people, feels like a true team, everyone tries to help each other, people genuinely like each other here. great parties too.

The ability to make money - this room buzzes with activity every single day - if you work hard and follow the lead of the senior recruiters (who are AWESOME!) you will be successful.

The owners are good people, they really care about their employees and dont micromanage.
cons: i have no complaints at all - i love working here.
advice_to_mgmt: ignore the people that are gone and trying to cause trouble - they were cancers here and everyone is glad there gone now

review_title: Great place to start a career
years_at_company: Great place to start a career
pros:
-Ability to grow quickly in the organization
-Awesome team
-Continuous Training
-Professional but fun environment
cons: -If you need to be micro managed to get your job done, this is probably not the place for you.
advice_to_mgmt: -Continue to promote from within and keep growing!

pros:
-Freedom work/life balance if you bill
-Potential to make a lot of money (at most recruiting firms and sales jobs)
cons:
-Horrible culture only getting worse
-Tremendous turnover (over 15-20 people over the last 2 years)
-They look through your private email if you access it from your work computer. They found out I was interviewing this way and it was extremely uncomfortable.
advice_to_mgmt: My advice to management is stop being paranoid because of the past and treat employees fairly and they will not look elsewhere and perform better for the firm because of it.

review_title: Excellent Training Ground for Successful Recruiters
years_at_company: Excellent Training Ground for Successful Recruiters
pros: Great training, senior management takes the time to get to know candidate recruiters
cons: Sometimes too many jobs to work on, gets overwhelming

pros: The people here are awesome. Everyone is super positive and they care about you and your development.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to think about different tracks for people.

pros: Recently started and the culture is great. Everyone has been very helpful training me. I am excited to be part of this company.
Gain experience in recruiting even if you are new to the field.
cons: Hard to get into if you are not meant for the field.

pros: They found me a position very quickly
cons: Operations people are incompetent and lack common sense.
advice_to_mgmt: This place has made too many payroll mistakes. First of all they pay on the 15th and last day of the month which is unheard of for temp/contract roles. I waited 4 weeks to get paid and they didn't have a check for me, nor did anyone reach out to inform me of the reasons why. I would never recommend anyone to this agency. They are horrible to work for and just don't cut it like other established agencies. If the reach out to you it might be best to run or else your trapped in a non-traditional temp/contract role which you will work for a month before you see your first paycheck.

pros: Few... The only pro is that they find a lot of job opportunities for candidates. That said, the opportunities are across a wide spectrum.
cons: Several.... They claim to perform a deep dive into a candidate's background in order to have a strong grasp on where a candidate stands in regards to their background, experience level, credentials, career aspirations, etc. They do not. They deceptively and aggressively sell you on a role by providing equivocal and often times "cookie cutter" job descriptions. Furthermore, they will nickel and dime your contract to the point that they are making more money per day or hour than you are... Consequently, you find yourself perplexed, defeated, and taken advantage of only a few weeks into your new career aka nightmare. In my honest opinion, there was a definitive lack of integrity, client-centric focus, and industry expertise.
